clinical_study.official_title: Scientific Evaluation of Oral Fluid Screening Devices and Preceding Selection Procedures

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland

collaborator.agency: Hospital District of Helsinki and Uusimaa

clinical_study.source: National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland

brief_summary.textblock:
This research includes the evaluation of a checklist and on-site screening devices to pre-select drivers suspected of being drug-impaired. The reliability of a limited number of promising on-site screening devices will be investigated. The devices tested will have to be promising regarding both reliability and practicality. In addition to the scientific evaluation of the checklist and the oral fluid screening devices, the time consumption of the selection procedure as a whole (checklist + oral fluid screening) will be evaluated.
Outcome of the study will be recommendations for the roadside selection procedure of drivers suspected of drug-related impairment. The recommendations will concentrate on the reliability of the selection procedure.
The study is part of an EU project DRUID. Two other countries in Europe take part to this study along with Finland.

primary_outcome.measure: scientific evaluation of the on-site oral fluid screening devices

secondary_outcome.measure: the time consumption of the selection procedure as a whole (checklist + oral fluid screening)

arm_group.description: Drivers suspected of driving under the influence of drugs
Drivers not suspected of driving under the influence of drugs

intervention.description: Comparison of screening device results to oral and/or blood sample results
Correlation of drug recognition expert observations to findings for drugs in non-suspected/suspected cases

biospec_descr.textblock: Oral fluid and whole blood are collected. However, no DNA testing will be carried out. The research focuses on drug and medicine concentrations in these matrices.

study_pop.textblock: Drivers suspected of driving under the influence of drugs. Also drivers who are not suspected of driving under the influence.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Drivers of motorised vehicles
- 18 years or older
- Willing to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Younger than 18
- Not willing to participate
